title: Ashwagandha and Adaptation: A Modern Overview
description: Exploring the adaptogenic profile of Withania somnifera and its evidence base.
excerpt: Ashwagandha (Withania somnifera) is often termed an adaptogen...
body:
Ashwagandha (Withania somnifera) is often termed an adaptogen because it appears to modulate the body's response to stressors rather than pushing in a single direction.

This post explores the clinical literature on cortisol regulation, sleep effects, and potential contraindications so that readers can situate the root within a modern nervous system toolkit.

Kava (Piper methysticum) carries centuries of ceremonial use. In modern contexts, standardization and chemotype selection matter more than ever.

This preview highlights the differences between noble and tudei cultivars, extraction methods, and safety markers to watch.
